00090 /**
00091  * Read the contents of the repository config file
00092  *
00093  * Calls r_init_fail and returns NULL in case of error.
00094  * @returns unparsed content of config file in a newly allocated charbuf
00095  */
00096 struct ccn_charbuf *
00097 r_init_read_config(struct ccnr_handle *h)
00098 {
00099     struct ccn_charbuf *path = NULL;
00100     struct ccn_charbuf *contents = NULL;
00101     size_t sz = 800;
00102     ssize_t sres = -1;
00103     int fd;
00104     
00105     h->directory = getenv("CCNR_DIRECTORY");
00106     if (h->directory == NULL || h->directory[0] == 0)
00107         h->directory = ".";
00108     path = ccn_charbuf_create();
00109     contents = ccn_charbuf_create();
00110     if (path == NULL || contents == NULL)
00111         return(NULL);
00112     ccn_charbuf_putf(path, "%s/config", h->directory);
00113     fd = open(ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), O_RDONLY);
00114     if (fd == -1) {
00115         if (errno == ENOENT)
00116             sres = 0;
00117         else
00118             r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, ccn_charbuf_as_string(path), errno);
00119     }
00120     else {
00121         for (;;) {
00122             sres = read(fd, ccn_charbuf_reserve(contents, sz), sz);
00123             if (sres == 0)
00124                 break;
00125             if (sres < 0) {
00126                 r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, "Read failed reading config", errno);
00127                 break;
00128             }
00129             contents->length += sres;
00130             if (contents->length > 999999) {
00131                 r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, "config file too large", 0);
00132                 sres = -1;
00133                 break;
00134             }
00135         }
00136         close(fd);
00137     }
00138     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&path);
00139     if (sres < 0)
00140         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&contents);
00141     return(contents);
00142 }
00143 
00144 static int
00145 r_init_debug_getenv(struct ccnr_handle *h, const char *envname)
00146 {
00147     const char *debugstr;
00148     int debugval;
00149     
00150     debugstr = getenv(envname);
00151     debugval = ccnr_msg_level_from_string(debugstr);
00152     /* Treat 1 and negative specially, for some backward compatibility. */
00153     if (debugval == 1)
00154         debugval = CCNL_WARNING;
00155     if (debugval < 0) {
00156         debugval = CCNL_FINEST;
00157         if (h != NULL)
00158             ccnr_msg(h, "%s='%s' is not valid, using FINEST", envname, debugstr);
00159     }
00160     return(debugval);
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * Get the specified numerical config value, subject to limits.
00165  */
00166 intmax_t
00167 r_init_confval(struct ccnr_handle *h, const char *key,
00168                      intmax_t lo, intmax_t hi, intmax_t deflt) {
00169     const char *s;
00170     intmax_t v;
00171     char *ep;
00172     
00173     if (!(lo <= deflt && deflt <= hi))
00174         abort();
00175     s = getenv(key);
00176     if (s != NULL && s[0] != 0) {
00177         ep = "x";
00178         v = strtoimax(s, &ep, 10);
00179         if (v != 0 || ep[0] == 0) {
00180             if (v > hi)
00181                 v = hi;
00182             if (v < lo)
00183                 v = lo;
00184             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, mmm, CCNL_FINEST))
00185                 ccnr_msg(h, "Using %s=%jd", key, v);
00186             return(v);
00187         }
00188     }
00189     return (deflt);
00190 }
00191 
00192 #define CCNR_CONFIG_PASSMASK   0x003 /* config pass */
00193 #define CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE 0x100 /* Set if there are prior problems */
00194 #define CCNR_CONFIG_ERR        0x200 /* Report error rather than warning */
00195 /**
00196  * Message helper for r_init_parse_config()
00197  */
00198 static void
00199 r_init_config_msg(struct ccnr_handle *h, int flags,
00200                   int line, int chindex, const char *msg)
00201 {
00202     const char *problem = "Problem";
00203     int log_at = CCNL_WARNING;
00204     
00205     log_at = CCNL_WARNING;
00206     if ((flags & CCNR_CONFIG_ERR) != 0) {
00207         problem = "Error";
00208         log_at = CCNL_ERROR;
00209     }
00210     if ((flags & (CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE|CCNR_CONFIG_PASSMASK)) == 1 &&
00211         CCNSHOULDLOG(h, mmm, log_at)) {
00212         ccnr_msg(h, "%s in config file %s/config - line %d column %d: %s",
00213                  problem, h->directory, line, chindex + 1, msg);
00214     }
00215 }
00216 
00217 /**
00218  * Parse the buffered configuration found in config
00219  *
00220  * The pass argument controls what is done with the result:
00221  *   0 - silent check for syntax errors;
00222  *   1 - check for syntax errors and warnings, logging the results,
00223  *   2 - incorporate settings into environ.
00224  *
00225  * @returns -1 if an error is found, otherwise the count of warnings.
00226  */
00227 int
00228 r_init_parse_config(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct ccn_charbuf *config, int pass)
00229 {
00230     struct ccn_charbuf *key = NULL;
00231     struct ccn_charbuf *value = NULL;
00232     const unsigned char *b;
00233     int line;
00234     size_t i;
00235     size_t sol; /* start of line */
00236     size_t len; /* config->len */
00237     size_t ndx; /* temp for column report*/
00238     int ch;
00239     int warns = 0;
00240     int errors = 0;
00241     int use_it = 0;
00242     static const char pclegal[] = 
00243         "~@%-+=:,./[]"
00244         "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
00245         "0123456789"
00246         "_"
00247         "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
00248     const char *klegal = strchr(pclegal, 'a');
00249     int flags; /* for reporting */
00250     
00251     b = config->buf;
00252     len = config->length;
00253     if (len == 0)
00254         return(0);
00255     ccn_charbuf_as_string(config);
00256     key = ccn_charbuf_create();
00257     value = ccn_charbuf_create();
00258     if (key == NULL || value == NULL)
00259         return(-1);
00260     /* Ensure there is null termination in the buffered config */
00261     if (ccn_charbuf_as_string(config) == NULL)
00262         return(-1);
00263     for (line = 1, i = 0, ch = b[0], sol = 0; i < len;) {
00264         flags = pass;
00265         use_it = 0;
00266         if (ch > ' ' && ch != '#') {
00267             key->length = value->length = 0;
00268             /* parse key */
00269             while (i < len && ch != '\n' && ch != '=') {
00270                 ccn_charbuf_append_value(key, ch, 1);
00271                 ch = b[++i];
00272             }
00273             if (ch == '=')
00274                 ch = b[++i];
00275             else {
00276                 r_init_config_msg(h, flags, line, key->length, "missing '='");
00277                 flags |= CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE;
00278                 warns++;
00279                 ch = '\n';
00280             }
00281             /* parse value */
00282             while (i < len && ch > ' ') {
00283                 ccn_charbuf_append_value(value, ch, 1);
00284                 ch = b[++i];
00285             }
00286             /* See if it might be one of ours */
00287             if (key->length < 5 || (memcmp(key->buf, "CCNR_", 5) != 0 &&
00288                                     memcmp(key->buf, "CCNS_", 5) != 0)) {
00289                 r_init_config_msg(h, flags, line, 0,
00290                                   "ignoring unrecognized key");
00291                 flags |= CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE;
00292                 warns++;
00293                 use_it = 0;
00294             }
00295             else
00296                 use_it = 1;
00297 
00298             /* Check charset of key */
00299             ndx = strspn(ccn_charbuf_as_string(key), klegal);
00300             if (ndx != key->length) {
00301                 errors += use_it;
00302                 r_init_config_msg(h, (flags | CCNR_CONFIG_ERR), line, ndx,
00303                                   "unexpected character in key");
00304                 flags |= CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE;
00305                 warns++;
00306             }
00307             /* Check charset of value */
00308             ndx = strspn(ccn_charbuf_as_string(value), pclegal);
00309             if (ndx != value->length) {
00310                 errors += use_it;
00311                 r_init_config_msg(h, (flags | CCNR_CONFIG_ERR),
00312                                   line, key->length + 1 + ndx,
00313                                   "unexpected character in value");
00314                 flags |= CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE;
00315                 warns++;
00316             }
00317         }
00318         if (ch == '#') {
00319             /* a comment line or error recovery. */
00320             while (i < len && ch != '\n')
00321                 ch = b[++i];
00322         }
00323         while (i < len && ch <= ' ') {
00324             if (ch == '\n') {
00325                 line++;
00326                 sol = i;
00327                 break;
00328             }
00329             if (memchr("\r\t ", ch, 3) == NULL) {
00330                 r_init_config_msg(h, pass, line, i - sol,
00331                                   "non-whitespace control char at end of line");
00332                 warns++;
00333             } 
00334             ch = b[++i];
00335         }
00336         if (i == len) {
00337             r_init_config_msg(h, flags, line, i - sol,
00338                               "missing newline at end of file");
00339             warns++;
00340             ch = '\n';
00341         }
00342         else if (ch == '\n')
00343             ch = b[++i];
00344         else {
00345             r_init_config_msg(h, flags, line, i - sol, "junk at end of line");
00346             flags |= CCNR_CONFIG_IGNORELINE;
00347             warns++;
00348             ch = '#';
00349         }
00350         if (flags == 0 && strcmp(ccn_charbuf_as_string(key), "CCNR_DEBUG") == 0) {
00351             /* Set this on pass 0 so that it takes effect sooner. */
00352             h->debug = 1;
00353             setenv("CCNR_DEBUG", ccn_charbuf_as_string(value), 1);
00354             h->debug = r_init_debug_getenv(h, "CCNR_DEBUG");
00355         }
00356         if (pass == 2 && use_it) {
00357             if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, mmm, CCNL_FINEST))
00358                 ccnr_msg(h, "config: %s=%s",
00359                         ccn_charbuf_as_string(key),
00360                         ccn_charbuf_as_string(value));
00361             setenv(ccn_charbuf_as_string(key), ccn_charbuf_as_string(value), 1);
00362         }
00363     }
00364     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&key);
00365     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&value);
00366     return(errors ? -1 : warns);
00367 }
00368 
00369 static int
00370 establish_min_send_bufsize(struct ccnr_handle *h, int fd, int minsize)
00371 {
00372     int res;
00373     int bufsize;
00374     int obufsize;
00375     socklen_t bufsize_sz;
00376 
00377     bufsize_sz = sizeof(bufsize);
00378     res = getsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, &bufsize, &bufsize_sz);
00379     if (res == -1)
00380         return (res);
00381     obufsize = bufsize;
00382     if (bufsize < minsize) {
00383         bufsize = minsize;
00384         res = setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, &bufsize, sizeof(bufsize));
00385         if (res == -1)
00386             return(res);
00387     }
00388     if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, sdfdsf, CCNL_INFO))
00389         ccnr_msg(h, "SO_SNDBUF for fd %d is %d (was %d)", fd, bufsize, obufsize);
00390     return(bufsize);
00391 }
00392 
00393 /**
00394  * If so configured, replace fd with a tcp socket
00395  * @returns new address family
00396  */
00397 static int
00398 try_tcp_instead(int fd)
00399 {
00400     struct addrinfo hints = {0};
00401     struct addrinfo *ai = NULL;
00402     const char *port = NULL;
00403     const char *proto = NULL;
00404     int res;
00405     int sock;
00406     int ans = AF_UNIX;
00407     int yes = 1;
00408     
00409     proto = getenv("CCNR_PROTO");
00410     if (proto == NULL || strcasecmp(proto, "tcp") != 0)
00411         return(ans);
00412     port = getenv("CCN_LOCAL_PORT");
00413     if (port == NULL || port[0] == 0)
00414         port = "9695";
00415     hints.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
00416     hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00417     hints.ai_flags = 0;
00418     hints.ai_protocol = 0;
00419     res = getaddrinfo(NULL, port, &hints, &ai);
00420     if (res == 0) {
00421         sock = socket(ai->ai_family, ai->ai_socktype, ai->ai_protocol);
00422         if (sock != -1) {
00423             res = connect(sock, ai->ai_addr, ai->ai_addrlen);
00424             if (res == 0) {
00425                 setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, &yes, sizeof(yes));
00426                 dup2(sock, fd);
00427                 ans = ai->ai_family;
00428             }
00429             else
00430                 close(sock);
00431         }
00432         freeaddrinfo(ai);
00433     }
00434     return(ans);
00435 }
00436 
00437 PUBLIC struct ccnr_parsed_policy *
00438 ccnr_parsed_policy_create(void)
00439 {
00440     struct ccnr_parsed_policy *pp;
00441     pp = calloc(1, sizeof(struct ccnr_parsed_policy));
00442     pp->store = ccn_charbuf_create();
00443     pp->namespaces = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00444     return(pp);
00445 }
00446 
00447 PUBLIC void
00448 ccnr_parsed_policy_destroy(struct ccnr_parsed_policy **ppp)
00449 {
00450     struct ccnr_parsed_policy *pp;
00451     
00452     if (*ppp == NULL)
00453         return;
00454     pp = *ppp;
00455     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pp->store);
00456     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&pp->namespaces);
00457     free(pp);
00458     *ppp = NULL;
00459 }
00460 
00461 /**
00462  * Create a new ccnr instance
00463  * @param progname - name of program binary, used for locating helpers
00464  * @param logger - logger function
00465  * @param loggerdata - data to pass to logger function
00466  */
00467 PUBLIC struct ccnr_handle *
00468 r_init_create(const char *progname, ccnr_logger logger, void *loggerdata)
00469 {
00470     char *sockname = NULL;
00471     const char *portstr = NULL;
00472     const char *listen_on = NULL;
00473     const char *d = NULL;
00474     struct ccnr_handle *h = NULL;
00475     struct hashtb_param param = {0};
00476     struct ccn_charbuf *config = NULL;
00477     int res;
00478     
00479     h = calloc(1, sizeof(*h));
00480     if (h == NULL)
00481         return(h);
00482     h->notify_after = 0; //CCNR_MAX_ACCESSION;
00483     h->logger = logger;
00484     h->loggerdata = loggerdata;
00485     h->logpid = (int)getpid();
00486     h->progname = progname;
00487     h->debug = -1;
00488     config = r_init_read_config(h);
00489     if (config == NULL)
00490         goto Bail;
00491     r_init_parse_config(h, config, 0); /* silent pass to pick up CCNR_DEBUG */
00492     h->debug = 1; /* so that we see any complaints */
00493     h->debug = r_init_debug_getenv(h, "CCNR_DEBUG");
00494     res = r_init_parse_config(h, config, 1);
00495     if (res < 0) {
00496         h->running = -1;
00497         goto Bail;
00498     }
00499     r_init_parse_config(h, config, 2);
00500     sockname = r_net_get_local_sockname();
00501     h->skiplinks = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00502     h->face_limit = 10; /* soft limit */
00503     h->fdholder_by_fd = calloc(h->face_limit, sizeof(h->fdholder_by_fd[0]));
00504     param.finalize_data = h;
00505     param.finalize = &r_fwd_finalize_nameprefix;
00506     h->nameprefix_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct nameprefix_entry), &param);
00507     param.finalize = 0; // PRUNED &r_fwd_finalize_propagating;
00508     h->propagating_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct propagating_entry), &param);
00509     param.finalize = &r_proto_finalize_enum_state;
00510     h->enum_state_tab = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct enum_state), &param);
00511     h->min_stale = ~0;
00512     h->max_stale = 0;
00513     h->unsol = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00514     h->ticktock.descr[0] = 'C';
00515     h->ticktock.micros_per_base = 1000000;
00516     h->ticktock.gettime = &r_util_gettime;
00517     h->ticktock.data = h;
00518     h->sched = ccn_schedule_create(h, &h->ticktock);
00519     h->starttime = h->sec;
00520     h->starttime_usec = h->usec;
00521     h->oldformatcontentgrumble = 1;
00522     h->oldformatinterestgrumble = 1;
00523     h->cob_limit = 4201;
00524     h->start_write_scope_limit = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_START_WRITE_SCOPE_LIMIT", 0, 3, 3);
00525     h->debug = 1; /* so that we see any complaints */
00526     h->debug = r_init_debug_getenv(h, "CCNR_DEBUG");
00527     h->syncdebug = r_init_debug_getenv(h, "CCNS_DEBUG");
00528     portstr = getenv("CCNR_STATUS_PORT");
00529     if (portstr == NULL || portstr[0] == 0 || strlen(portstr) > 10)
00530         portstr = "";
00531     h->portstr = portstr;
00532     ccnr_msg(h, "CCNR_DEBUG=%d CCNR_DIRECTORY=%s CCNR_STATUS_PORT=%s", h->debug, h->directory, h->portstr);
00533     listen_on = getenv("CCNR_LISTEN_ON");
00534     if (listen_on != NULL && listen_on[0] != 0)
00535         ccnr_msg(h, "CCNR_LISTEN_ON=%s", listen_on);
00536     
00537     if (ccnr_init_repo_keystore(h, NULL) < 0) {
00538         h->running = -1;
00539         goto Bail;
00540     }
00541     r_util_reseed(h);
00542     r_store_init(h);
00543     if (h->running == -1) goto Bail;
00544     while (h->active_in_fd >= 0) {
00545         r_dispatch_process_input(h, h->active_in_fd);
00546         r_store_trim(h, h->cob_limit);
00547         ccn_schedule_run(h->sched);
00548     }
00549     ccnr_msg(h, "Repository file is indexed");
00550     if (h->face0 == NULL) {
00551         struct fdholder *fdholder;
00552         fdholder = calloc(1, sizeof(*fdholder));
00553         if (dup2(open("/dev/null", O_RDONLY), 0) == -1)
00554             ccnr_msg(h, "stdin: %s", strerror(errno));
00555         fdholder->filedesc = 0;
00556         fdholder->flags = (CCNR_FACE_GG | CCNR_FACE_NORECV);
00557         r_io_enroll_face(h, fdholder);
00558     }
00559     ccnr_direct_client_start(h);
00560     d = getenv("CCNR_SKIP_VERIFY");
00561 #if (CCN_API_VERSION >= 4004)
00562     if (d != NULL && strcmp(d, "1") == 0) {
00563         ccnr_msg(h, "CCNR_SKIP_VERIFY=%s", d);
00564         ccn_defer_verification(h->direct_client, 1);
00565     }
00566 #endif
00567     if (ccn_connect(h->direct_client, NULL) != -1) {
00568         int af = 0;
00569         int bufsize;
00570         int flags;
00571         int fd;
00572         struct fdholder *fdholder;
00573 
00574         fd = ccn_get_connection_fd(h->direct_client);
00575         // Play a dirty trick here - if this wins, we can fix it right in the c lib later on...
00576         af = try_tcp_instead(fd);  
00577         flags = CCNR_FACE_CCND;
00578         if (af == AF_INET)
00579             flags |= CCNR_FACE_INET;
00580         else if (af == AF_INET6)
00581             flags |= CCNR_FACE_INET6;
00582         else
00583             flags |= CCNR_FACE_LOCAL;
00584         fdholder = r_io_record_fd(h, fd, "CCND", 5, flags);
00585         if (fdholder == NULL) abort();
00586         ccnr_uri_listen(h, h->direct_client, "ccnx:/%C1.M.S.localhost/%C1.M.SRV/repository",
00587                         &ccnr_answer_req, OP_SERVICE);
00588         ccnr_uri_listen(h, h->direct_client, "ccnx:/%C1.M.S.neighborhood/%C1.M.SRV/repository",
00589                         &ccnr_answer_req, OP_SERVICE);
00590         bufsize = r_init_confval(h, "CCNR_MIN_SEND_BUFSIZE", 1, 2097152, 16384);
00591         establish_min_send_bufsize(h, fd, bufsize);
00592     }
00593     else
00594         ccn_disconnect(h->direct_client); // Apparently ccn_connect error case needs work.
00595     if (1 == r_init_confval(h, "CCNS_ENABLE", 0, 1, 1)) {
00596         h->sync_plumbing = calloc(1, sizeof(struct sync_plumbing));
00597         h->sync_plumbing->ccn = h->direct_client;
00598         h->sync_plumbing->sched = h->sched;
00599         h->sync_plumbing->client_methods = &sync_client_methods;
00600         h->sync_plumbing->client_data = h;
00601         h->sync_base = SyncNewBaseForActions(h->sync_plumbing);
00602     }
00603     if (-1 == load_policy(h))
00604         goto Bail;
00605     r_net_listen_on(h, listen_on);
00606     ccnr_internal_client_start(h);
00607     r_proto_init(h);
00608     r_proto_activate_policy(h, h->parsed_policy);
00609     if (merge_files(h) == -1)
00610         r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, "Unable to merge additional repository data files.", errno);
00611     if (h->running == -1) goto Bail;
00612     if (h->sync_plumbing) {
00613         // Start sync running
00614         // returns < 0 if a failure occurred
00615         // returns 0 if the name updates should fully restart
00616         // returns > 0 if the name updates should restart at last fence
00617         res = h->sync_plumbing->sync_methods->sync_start(h->sync_plumbing, NULL);
00618         if (res < 0) {
00619             r_init_fail(h, __LINE__, "starting sync", res);
00620             abort();
00621         }
00622         else if (res > 0) {
00623             // XXX: need to work out details of starting from last fence.
00624             // By examination of code, SyncActions won't take this path
00625         }
00626     }
00627 Bail:
00628     if (sockname)
00629         free(sockname);
00630     sockname = NULL;
00631     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&config);
00632     if (h->running == -1)
00633         r_init_destroy(&h);
00634     return(h);
00635 }
00636 
00637 void
00638 r_init_fail(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, int line, const char *culprit, int err)
00639 {
00640     if (err > 0)
00641         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Startup failure %d %s - %s", line, culprit,
00642                  strerror(err));
00643     else {
00644         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Startup failure %d %s - error %d", line, culprit, err);
00645     }
00646     ccnr->running = -1;
00647 }
00648 
00649 /**
00650  * Destroy the ccnr instance, releasing all associated resources.
00651  */
00652 PUBLIC void
00653 r_init_destroy(struct ccnr_handle **pccnr)
00654 {
00655     struct ccnr_handle *h = *pccnr;
00656     int stable;
00657     if (h == NULL)
00658         return;
00659     stable = h->active_in_fd == -1 ? 1 : 0;
00660     r_io_shutdown_all(h);
00661     ccnr_direct_client_stop(h);
00662     ccn_schedule_destroy(&h->sched);
00663     hashtb_destroy(&h->propagating_tab);
00664     hashtb_destroy(&h->nameprefix_tab);
00665     hashtb_destroy(&h->enum_state_tab);
00666     hashtb_destroy(&h->content_by_accession_tab);
00667 
00668     // SyncActions sync_stop method should be shutting down heartbeat
00669     if (h->sync_plumbing) {
00670         h->sync_plumbing->sync_methods->sync_stop(h->sync_plumbing, NULL);
00671         free(h->sync_plumbing);
00672         h->sync_plumbing = NULL;
00673         h->sync_base = NULL; // freed by sync_stop ?
00674     }
00675     
00676     r_store_final(h, stable);
00677     
00678     if (h->fds != NULL) {
00679         free(h->fds);
00680         h->fds = NULL;
00681         h->nfds = 0;
00682     }
00683     if (h->fdholder_by_fd != NULL) {
00684         free(h->fdholder_by_fd);
00685         h->fdholder_by_fd = NULL;
00686         h->face_limit = h->face_gen = 0;
00687     }
00688     if (h->content_by_cookie != NULL) {
00689         free(h->content_by_cookie);
00690         h->content_by_cookie = NULL;
00691         h->cookie_limit = 1;
00692     }
00693     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->scratch_charbuf);
00694     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->skiplinks);
00695     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->scratch_indexbuf);
00696     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->unsol);
00697     if (h->parsed_policy != NULL) {
00698         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->parsed_policy->namespaces);
00699         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->parsed_policy->store);
00700         free(h->parsed_policy);
00701         h->parsed_policy = NULL;
00702     }
00703     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->policy_name);
00704     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->policy_link_cob);
00705     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->ccnr_keyid);
00706     free(h);
00707     *pccnr = NULL;
00708 }
00709 
00710 int
00711 r_init_map_and_process_file(struct ccnr_handle *h, struct ccn_charbuf *filename, int add_content)
00712 {
00713     int res = 0;
00714     int dres;
00715     struct stat statbuf;
00716     unsigned char *mapped_file = MAP_FAILED;
00717     unsigned char *msg;
00718     size_t size;
00719     int fd = -1;
00720     struct content_entry *content;
00721     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d;
00722     struct fdholder *fdholder;
00723     
00724     fd = r_io_open_repo_data_file(h, ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename), 0);
00725     if (fd == -1)   // Normal exit
00726         return(1);
00727     
00728     res = fstat(fd, &statbuf);
00729     if (res != 0) {
00730         ccnr_msg(h, "stat failed for %s (fd=%d), %s (errno=%d)",
00731                  ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename), fd, strerror(errno), errno);
00732         res = -errno;
00733         goto Bail;
00734     }
00735     if (statbuf.st_size == 0)
00736         goto Bail;
00737     
00738     mapped_file = mmap(NULL, statbuf.st_size, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fd, 0);
00739     if (mapped_file == MAP_FAILED) {
00740         ccnr_msg(h, "mmap failed for %s (fd=%d), %s (errno=%d)",
00741                  ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename), fd, strerror(errno), errno);
00742         res = -errno;
00743         goto Bail;
00744     }
00745     fdholder = r_io_fdholder_from_fd(h, fd);
00746     d = &fdholder->decoder;
00747     msg = mapped_file;
00748     size = statbuf.st_size;
00749     while (d->index < size) {
00750         dres = ccn_skeleton_decode(d, msg + d->index, size - d->index);
00751         if (!CCN_FINAL_DSTATE(d->state))
00752             break;
00753         if (add_content) {
00754             content = process_incoming_content(h, fdholder, msg + d->index - dres, dres, NULL);
00755             if (content != NULL)
00756                 r_store_commit_content(h, content);
00757         }
00758     }
00759     
00760     if (d->index != size || !CCN_FINAL_DSTATE(d->state)) {
00761         ccnr_msg(h, "protocol error on fdholder %u (state %d), discarding %d bytes",
00762                  fdholder->filedesc, d->state, (int)(size - d->index));
00763         res = -1;
00764         goto Bail;
00765     }
00766     
00767 Bail:
00768     if (mapped_file != MAP_FAILED)
00769         munmap(mapped_file, statbuf.st_size);
00770     r_io_shutdown_client_fd(h, fd);
00771     return (res);
00772 }
00773 
00774 static int
00775 merge_files(struct ccnr_handle *h)
00776 {
00777     int i, last_file;
00778     int res;
00779     struct ccn_charbuf *filename = ccn_charbuf_create();
00780     
00781     // first parse the file(s) making sure there are no errors
00782     for (i = 2;; i++) {
00783         filename->length = 0;
00784         ccn_charbuf_putf(filename, "repoFile%d", i);
00785         res = r_init_map_and_process_file(h, filename, 0);
00786         if (res == 1)
00787             break;
00788         if (res < 0) {
00789             ccnr_msg(h, "Error parsing repository file %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename));
00790             return (-1);
00791         }
00792     }
00793     last_file = i - 1;
00794     
00795     for (i = 2; i <= last_file; i++) {
00796         filename->length = 0;
00797         ccn_charbuf_putf(filename, "repoFile%d", i);
00798         res = r_init_map_and_process_file(h, filename, 1);
00799         if (res < 0) {
00800             ccnr_msg(h, "Error in phase 2 incorporating repository file %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename));
00801             return (-1);
00802         }
00803     }
00804     
00805     for (i = last_file; i > 1; --i) {
00806         filename->length = 0;
00807         ccn_charbuf_putf(filename, "%s/repoFile%d", h->directory, i);
00808         if (CCNSHOULDLOG(h, LM_128, CCNL_INFO))
00809             ccnr_msg(h, "unlinking %s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename));   
00810         unlink(ccn_charbuf_as_string(filename));
00811     }
00812     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&filename);
00813     return (0);
00814 }
00815 
00816 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00817 ccnr_init_policy_cob(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, struct ccn *h,
00818                      struct ccn_charbuf *basename,
00819                      int freshness, struct ccn_charbuf *content)
00820 {
00821     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00822     struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00823     struct ccn_charbuf *pubid = ccn_charbuf_create();
00824     struct ccn_charbuf *pubkey = ccn_charbuf_create();
00825     struct ccn_charbuf *keyid = ccn_charbuf_create();
00826     struct ccn_charbuf *tcob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00827     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = NULL;          // result
00828     int res;
00829     
00830     res = ccn_get_public_key(h, NULL, pubid, pubkey);
00831     if (res < 0) 
00832         goto Leave;
00833     res = ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(name, basename);
00834     if (ccn_name_from_uri(name, "%00") < 0)
00835         goto Leave;
00836     sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00837     sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_DATA;
00838     sp.freshness = freshness;
00839     res |= ccn_sign_content(h, tcob, name, &sp, content->buf, content->length);
00840     if (res == 0) {
00841         cob = tcob;
00842         tcob = NULL;
00843     }
00844     
00845 Leave:
00846     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00847     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pubid);
00848     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pubkey);
00849     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&keyid);
00850     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tcob);
00851     return (cob);
00852 }
00853 /**
00854  * should probably return a new cob, rather than reusing one.
00855  * should publish link as:
00856  *    CCNRID_POLICY_URI("ccnx:/%C1.M.S.localhost/%C1.M.SRV/repository/POLICY)/%C1.M.K<pubid>/<version>/%00
00857  * should have key locator which is the key name of the repository
00858  */
00859 PUBLIC struct ccn_charbuf *
00860 ccnr_init_policy_link_cob(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, struct ccn *h,
00861                           struct ccn_charbuf *targetname)
00862 {
00863     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00864     struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00865     struct ccn_charbuf *pubid = ccn_charbuf_create();
00866     struct ccn_charbuf *pubkey = ccn_charbuf_create();
00867     struct ccn_charbuf *keyid = ccn_charbuf_create();
00868     struct ccn_charbuf *content = ccn_charbuf_create();
00869     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00870     struct ccn_charbuf *answer = NULL;
00871     int res;
00872     
00873     res = ccn_get_public_key(h, NULL, pubid, pubkey);
00874     if (res < 0)
00875         goto Bail;
00876     if (ccn_name_from_uri(name, CCNRID_POLICY_URI) < 0)
00877         goto Bail;
00878     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_value(keyid, CCN_MARKER_CONTROL, 1);
00879     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_string(keyid, ".M.K");
00880     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_value(keyid, 0, 1);
00881     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(keyid, pubid);
00882     res |= ccn_name_append(name, keyid->buf, keyid->length);
00883     res |= ccn_create_version(h, name, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
00884     if (ccn_name_from_uri(name, "%00") < 0)
00885         goto Bail;
00886     sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00887     sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_LINK;
00888     res |= ccnb_append_Link(content, targetname, "Repository Policy", NULL);
00889     if (res != 0)
00890         goto Bail;
00891     res |= ccn_sign_content(h, cob, name, &sp, content->buf, content->length);
00892     if (res != 0)
00893         goto Bail;
00894     answer = cob;
00895     cob = NULL;
00896     
00897 Bail:
00898     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00899     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pubid);
00900     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pubkey);
00901     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&keyid);
00902     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&content);
00903     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00904     return (answer);
00905 }
00906 
00907 
00908 /**
00909  * Load a link to the repo policy from the repoPolicy file and load the link
00910  * target to extract the actual policy.
00911  * If a policy file does not exist a new one is created, with a link to a policy
00912  * based either on the environment variable CCNR_GLOBAL_PREFIX or the system
00913  * default value of ccnx:/parc.com/csl/ccn/Repos, plus the system defaults for
00914  * other fields.
00915  * This routine must be called after the btree code is initialized and capable
00916  * of returning content objects.
00917  * Sets the parsed_policy field of the handle to be the new policy.
00918  */
00919 static int
00920 load_policy(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr)
00921 {
00922     int fd;
00923     ssize_t res;
00924     struct content_entry *content = NULL;
00925     const unsigned char *content_msg = NULL;
00926     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pco = {0};
00927     struct ccn_parsed_Link pl = {0};
00928     struct ccn_indexbuf *nc = NULL;
00929     struct ccn_charbuf *basename = NULL;
00930     struct ccn_charbuf *policy = NULL;
00931     struct ccn_charbuf *policy_cob = NULL;
00932     struct ccn_charbuf *policyFileName;
00933     const char *global_prefix;
00934     const unsigned char *buf = NULL;
00935     size_t length = 0;
00936     int segment = 0;
00937     int final = 0;
00938     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00939     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
00940     
00941     policyFileName = ccn_charbuf_create();
00942     ccn_charbuf_putf(policyFileName, "%s/repoPolicy", ccnr->directory);
00943     ccnr->parsed_policy = ccnr_parsed_policy_create();
00944     fd = open(ccn_charbuf_as_string(policyFileName), O_RDONLY);
00945     if (fd >= 0) {
00946         ccnr->policy_link_cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00947         ccn_charbuf_reserve(ccnr->policy_link_cob, 4096);   // limits the size of the policy link
00948         ccnr->policy_link_cob->length = 0;    // clear the buffer
00949         res = read(fd, ccnr->policy_link_cob->buf, ccnr->policy_link_cob->limit - ccnr->policy_link_cob->length);
00950         close(fd);
00951         if (res == -1) {
00952             r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Error reading repoPolicy file.", errno);
00953             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&ccnr->policy_link_cob);
00954             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policyFileName);
00955             return(-1);
00956         }
00957         ccnr->policy_link_cob->length = res;
00958         nc = ccn_indexbuf_create();
00959         res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(ccnr->policy_link_cob->buf,
00960                                       ccnr->policy_link_cob->length, &pco, nc);
00961         res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Content, ccnr->policy_link_cob->buf,
00962                                   pco.offset[CCN_PCO_B_Content],
00963                                   pco.offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content],
00964                                   &buf, &length);
00965         d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, buf, length);
00966         res = ccn_parse_Link(d, &pl, NULL);
00967         if (res <= 0) {
00968             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Policy link is malformed.");
00969             goto CreateNewPolicy;
00970         }
00971         basename = ccn_charbuf_create();
00972         ccn_charbuf_append(basename, buf + pl.offset[CCN_PL_B_Name],
00973                            pl.offset[CCN_PL_E_Name] - pl.offset[CCN_PL_B_Name]);
00974         ccnr->policy_name = ccn_charbuf_create(); // to detect writes to this name
00975         ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(ccnr->policy_name, basename); // has version
00976         ccn_name_chop(ccnr->policy_name, NULL, -1); // get rid of version
00977         policy = ccn_charbuf_create();
00978         // if we fail to retrieve the link target, report and then create a new one
00979         do {
00980             ccn_name_append_numeric(basename, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, segment++);
00981             content = r_store_lookup_ccnb(ccnr, basename->buf, basename->length);
00982             if (content == NULL) {
00983                 ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "policy lookup failed for", NULL,
00984                                 basename->buf, basename->length);
00985                 break;
00986             }
00987             ccn_name_chop(basename, NULL, -1);
00988             content_msg = r_store_content_base(ccnr, content);
00989             if (content_msg == NULL) {
00990                 ccnr_debug_ccnb(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to read policy object", NULL,
00991                                 basename->buf, basename->length);
00992                 break;
00993             }
00994             res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(content_msg, r_store_content_size(ccnr, content), &pco, nc);
00995             res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Content, content_msg,
00996                                       pco.offset[CCN_PCO_B_Content],
00997                                       pco.offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content],
00998                                       &buf, &length);
00999             ccn_charbuf_append(policy, buf, length);
01000             final = ccn_is_final_pco(content_msg, &pco, nc);
01001         } while (!final && segment < 100);
01002         if (policy->length == 0) {
01003             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Policy link points to empty or non-existent policy.");
01004             goto CreateNewPolicy;
01005         }
01006         if (segment >= 100) {
01007             r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Policy link points to policy with too many segments.", 0);
01008             return(-1);
01009         }
01010         if (r_proto_parse_policy(ccnr, policy->buf, policy->length, ccnr->parsed_policy) < 0) {
01011             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Policy link points to malformed policy.");
01012             goto CreateNewPolicy;
01013         }
01014         res = ccn_name_comp_get(content_msg, nc, nc->n - 3, &buf, &length);
01015         if (length != 7 || buf[0] != CCN_MARKER_VERSION) {
01016             ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Policy link points to unversioned policy.");
01017             goto CreateNewPolicy;
01018         }
01019         memmove(ccnr->parsed_policy->version, buf, sizeof(ccnr->parsed_policy->version));
01020         ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&nc);
01021         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&basename);
01022         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policy);
01023         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policyFileName);
01024         return (0);
01025     }
01026     
01027 CreateNewPolicy:
01028     // clean up if we had previously done some allocation
01029     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&nc);
01030     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&basename);
01031     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policy);
01032     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&ccnr->policy_name);
01033     ccnr_msg(ccnr, "Creating new policy file.");
01034     // construct the policy content object
01035     global_prefix = getenv ("CCNR_GLOBAL_PREFIX");
01036     if (global_prefix != NULL)
01037         ccnr_msg(ccnr, "CCNR_GLOBAL_PREFIX=%s", global_prefix);
01038     else 
01039         global_prefix = "ccnx:/parc.com/csl/ccn/Repos";
01040     policy = ccn_charbuf_create();
01041     r_proto_policy_append_basic(ccnr, policy, "1.5", "Repository", global_prefix);
01042     r_proto_policy_append_namespace(ccnr, policy, "/");
01043     basename = ccn_charbuf_create();
01044     res = ccn_name_from_uri(basename, global_prefix);
01045     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(basename, "data/policy.xml");
01046     if (res < 0) {
01047         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Global prefix is not a valid URI", 0);
01048         return(-1);
01049     }
01050     ccnr->policy_name = ccn_charbuf_create(); // to detect writes to this name
01051     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(ccnr->policy_name, basename);
01052     ccn_create_version(ccnr->direct_client, basename, 0,
01053                        ccnr->starttime, ccnr->starttime_usec * 1000);
01054     policy_cob = ccnr_init_policy_cob(ccnr, ccnr->direct_client, basename,
01055                                       600, policy);
01056     // save the policy content object to the repository
01057     content = process_incoming_content(ccnr, ccnr->face0,
01058                                        (void *)policy_cob->buf,
01059                                        policy_cob->length, NULL);
01060     r_store_commit_content(ccnr, content);
01061     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policy_cob);
01062     // make a link to the policy content object
01063     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&ccnr->policy_link_cob);
01064     ccnr->policy_link_cob = ccnr_init_policy_link_cob(ccnr, ccnr->direct_client,
01065                                                       basename);
01066     if (ccnr->policy_link_cob == NULL) {
01067         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to create policy link object", 0);
01068         return(-1);
01069     }
01070     
01071     fd = open(ccn_charbuf_as_string(policyFileName), O_WRONLY | O_CREAT, 0666);
01072     if (fd < 0) {
01073         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to open repoPolicy file for write", errno);
01074         return(-1);
01075     }
01076     lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET);
01077     res = write(fd, ccnr->policy_link_cob->buf, ccnr->policy_link_cob->length);
01078     if (res == -1) {
01079         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to write repoPolicy file", errno);
01080         return(-1);
01081     }
01082     res = ftruncate(fd, ccnr->policy_link_cob->length);
01083     close(fd);
01084     if (res == -1) {
01085         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to truncate repoPolicy file", errno);
01086         return(-1);
01087     }
01088     // parse the policy for later use
01089     if (r_proto_parse_policy(ccnr, policy->buf, policy->length, ccnr->parsed_policy) < 0) {
01090         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to parse new repoPolicy file", 0);
01091         return(-1);
01092     }
01093     // get the pp->version from the policy_cob base name .../policy.xml/<ver>
01094     nc = ccn_indexbuf_create();
01095     ccn_name_split(basename, nc);
01096     res = ccn_name_comp_get(basename->buf, nc, nc->n - 2, &buf, &length);
01097     if (length != 7 || buf[0] != CCN_MARKER_VERSION) {
01098         r_init_fail(ccnr, __LINE__, "Unable to get repository policy object version", 0);
01099         return(-1);
01100     }
01101     memmove(ccnr->parsed_policy->version, buf, sizeof(ccnr->parsed_policy->version));
01102     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&nc);
01103     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&basename);
01104     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policy);
01105     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&policyFileName);
01106     return(0);
01107 }
01108
Generated on Mon Feb 4 11:56:45 2013 for Content-Centric Networking in C by  1.6.3
